contentrichtext.text: {{Japanese city | Name = Kazo| JapaneseName=加須市 | Prefecture=[[Saitama Prefecture|Saitama]] | Region=[[Kantō region|Kantō]] | Area_km2=133.47 | Population=117,339 | PopDate=April 1, 2011 | Density_km2= auto | Coords = {{coord|36|7|42|N|139|36|18|E|region:JP_type:city}} | Postal code=| Area code=| LatitudeDegrees= 36| LatitudeMinutes= 7| LatitudeSeconds= 42| LongtitudeDegrees= 139| LongtitudeMinutes= 36| LongtitudeSeconds= 18| Mayor = Ryoichi Ohashi (since July 2005)| Tree = [[Ginkgo biloba]]| Flower = [[Rhododendron indicum]]| Bird = | SymbolImage= Flag of Kazo Saitama.JPG| CityHallPostalCode = 347-8501| CityHallAddress= Shimo-Mimata 290, Kazo-city, Saitama Prefecture (埼玉県加須市下三俣２９０)| CityHallPhone= 81-(0)480-62-1111| CityHallLink = [http://www.city.kazo.saitama.jp/ Kazo]| MapImage=Kazo in Saitama Prefecture Ja.svg| Elevation=| }} {{nihongo|'''Kazo'''|加須市|Kazo-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Saitama Prefecture|Saitama]], [[Japan]]. As of April 1, 2011, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 117,339, with a [[household]] number of 42,778, and a [[population density|density]] of 879.14 persons per km². The total area is 133.47 km². The city was founded on May 3, 1954 and is known throughout Japan for the creation of [[koinobori]] (carp kites), baseballs, [[Bōgu|kendo equipment]], and [[udon]]. On March 23, 2010, Kazo City absorbed the towns of [[Kisai, Saitama|Kisai]], [[Kitakawabe, Saitama|Kitakawabe]], and [[Ōtone, Saitama|Ōtone]], all from [[Kita-Saitama District, Saitama|Kita-Saitama District]], to form the current Kazo City. Kita-Saitama District was dissolved as a result of this merger. ==External links== {{Commons category-inline}} * [http://www.city.kazo.lg.jp/ Kazo official website] {{ja icon}} {{Saitama}} [[Category:Cities in Saitama Prefecture]] {{Saitama-geo-stub}}
